iati-activity.description: Haramaya Wereda is facing increasing water shortages due to overexploitation and mismanagement of its water resources. The project will be aimed at enhancing crop water productivity through the integration of shallow well with simple and low-cost water lifting and small holder drip irrigation technologies. Moreover, training on rainwater harvesting, 3R, watershed management, OM of shallow wells and installation of drip kits will be considered.

iati-activity.description: RWH for household level drip Irrigation in Haramaya woreda

The overall, long term objective of this study (and its planned continuation) is to improve the livelihoods of Haramaya small-scale farmers, without degrading the scarce water resources, by increasing crop water productivity ratio with an appropriate, feasible and affordable irrigation technology.

location.name: Haramaya Woreda, Ethiopia
location.description: The project area, Haramaya District, is first populous wereda with population density of 360 persons/km2. The estimated rural population of the catchment is about 18932 with male/female ratio of 104/100. The average household size is 4.74 a total of more than 3360 households. The livelihood of the community is mainly based on mixed farming, that is, cropping and livestock production. Despite the high population pressure, the lands are intensively cultivated. All marginal and grazing lands are brought under cultivation.
